folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billop House, or "Conference House." In this house was held the famous conference between a committee representing the Continental Congress, consisting of Benjamin Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge and Admiral Lord Howe. The house derives its name from Christopher Billopp.
About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the rear of the house.
1924
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A front view of the house.
September 19, 1925
P. I. Sperr

folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billop House, or "Conference House." In this house was held, on September 11, 1776, a conference between Benjamin Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge representing the Continental Congress and Admiral Lord Howe, commanding the British naval forces. The house derives its name from Christopher Billop, who circumnavigated Staten Island in less than twenty-four hours and claimed it for New York State.

About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

(2)
The basement kitchen of the Billopp House.

About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billopp House (also called "Conference House"). It was built in 1688 by Christopher Billopp who aided New York's claim to Staten Island by circumnavigating the island in his own vessel in less than twenty-four hours. In this house took place a conference between Howe and an American committee, composed of Adams, Franklin and Rutledge.
About 1930
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Line drawing illustration of house with two leafless trees flanking a winding driveway.

Caption: The Billopp House[;] Tottenville, Staten Island.

folder: Hylan Boulevard & Satterlee Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
BILLOPP HOUSE  Hylan Boulevard and Satterlee Street, Tottenville, Staten Island. Built by and for Christopher Billopp about 1680, this Dutch Colonial residence was for many years a center of gracious New York hospitality. It is Known also as "Conference House" because Benjamin Franklin, John Adams and Edward Rutledge met here with the English general, Lord Howe, on September 11, 1776, in an unsuccessful effort to halt the American Revolution.

Bank of New York Calendar 1967-68
